meanings.definition: The act of closing and opening the eyelids quickly.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't believe her eyes when, in just a few eyeblinks, the magician made the rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent2: In the dark forest, the only sound was the rustling of leaves and the occasional eyeblinks of nocturnal animals.
meanings.sent3: During the scary movie, the monster appeared out of nowhere, causing many eyeblinks in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to stand still as she waited for his answer, each second feeling like an eternity of eyeblinks.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm passed in a flurry of lightning and thunder, the sky lighting up with each eyeblink.

meanings.definition: A very short period of time.
meanings.sent1: The race was over in a few eyeblinks, with the winner crossing the finish line in a blur of speed.
meanings.sent2: The meeting lasted only a few eyeblinks before everyone went back to their daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared the dish in the kitchen in just a couple of eyeblinks, impressing the guests with his speed.
meanings.sent4: The sun set in a series of eyeblinks, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The baby's first year passed in a whirlwind of milestones, each moment feeling like an eyeblink in time.
